title: getting-started
text: rgoogleclassroom Google API wrapper allows use Google Classroom Google Forms coziness comfort R. can read rgoogleclassroom package documentation .

title: getting-started
text: use package need Google Classroom account. Go get : https://edu.google.com/workspace--education/classroom/

title: getting-started
text: want development version (advised) can install using remotes package install GitHub.

title: getting-started
text: order make new course rgoogleclassroom need owner id. can get running following: `owner_id <- get_owner_id()

title: getting-started
text: start, need authorize() package access files. Select scopes feel comfortable sharing. Note need select certain scopes certain functions work. can running authorize() function. can authorize programmatically using secret use auth_from_secret() function.

title: getting-started
text: different objects Google API: courses forms courseWorks courseWork Materials topics objects functions following: get_<object>_list() create_<object>() get_<object>_properties() delete_<object>() example: get_course_list(owner_id) retrieves list courses particular owner id. create_course() creates course get_course_properties(course_id) retrieves properties course given id. can built together pretty nifty.

title: getting-started
text: Run function authorize app use Google account. Retrieve whatever owner id Google Classroom . Now can retrieve list courses associated owner id. following examples, need use
code: authorize() owner_id <- get_owner_id() course_df <- get_course_list(owner_id) Create a course new_course <- create_course(owner_id$id, name = "New course")

title: getting-started
text: can create new material students using building together like : Retrieve list materials course
code: # Create a course we will use for this test owner_id <- get_owner_id() new_course <- create_course(owner_id$id, name = "New course")  # Create material at this course new_material <- create_material(course_id = new_course$id,                                 title = "New material")  # Retrieve the material info materials_info <- get_materials_properties(course_id = new_course$id,                                              materials_id = new_material$id) materials_list <- get_materials_list(course_id = new_course$id)

title: getting-started
text: can manage courseworks! â€™s mandatory Google API due dates courseworks given.
code: # Create a new coursework new_coursework <- create_coursework(course_id = new_course$id,                                     title = "New coursework",                                     due_date = lubridate::today() + lubridate::hours(24))  # Get coursework properties course_work_info <- get_coursework_properties(course_id = new_course$id, coursework_id = new_coursework$id)  # Retrieve all the courseworks for this course coursework_list <- get_coursework_list(course_id = new_course$id)

title: getting-started
text: can build quiz like : can create new multiple choice question quiz just made using steps: can create text question quiz :
code: course_id <- get_course_list()$courses$id[1]  quiz_form_id <- create_quiz(   course_id = course_id,   quiz_title = "new quiz",   quiz_description = "This is a great quiz",   due_date = "2025-12-1") create_multiple_choice_question(   form_id = quiz_form_id$formId,   question = "What answer do you want?",   choice_vector = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   correct_answer = 3,   shuffle_opt = TRUE ) create_text_question(   form_id = quiz_form_id$formId,   question = "Put some text here to answer this question",  )

title: getting-started
text: can delete course, archive : can delete :

title: Authors and Citation
text: Candace Savonen. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Savonen C (2023). rgoogleclassroom: API Wrapper Google Classroom Google Forms. R package version 0.9.1, https://github.com/datatrail-jhu/rgoogleclassroom.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rgoogleclassroom: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms},   author = {Candace Savonen},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.9.1},   url = {https://github.com/datatrail-jhu/rgoogleclassroom}, }

what: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: rgoogleclassroom Google API wrapper allows use Google Classroom Google Forms coziness comfort R. can read rgoogleclassroom package documentation . use package need Google Classroom account. Go get : https://edu.google.com/workspace--education/classroom/

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: want development version (advised) can install using remotes package install GitHub.

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: start, need authorize() package access files. Select scopes feel comfortable sharing. Note need select certain scopes certain functions work.

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: different objects Google API: courses forms courseWorks courseWork Materials topics objects functions following: get_<object>_list() create_<object>() get_<object>_properties() example: get_course_list(owner_id) retrieves list courses particular owner id. create_course() creates course get_course_properties(course_id) retrieves properties course given id. can built together pretty nifty.

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: Run function authorize app use Google account. Retrieve whatever owner id Google Classroom . Now can retrieve list courses associated owner id. following examples, need use
code: authorize() owner_id <- get_owner_id() course_df <- get_course_list(owner_id) Create a course new_course <- create_course(owner_id$id, name = "New course")

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: can create new material students using building together like : Retrieve list materials course
code: # Create a course we will use for this test owner_id <- get_owner_id() new_course <- create_course(owner_id$id, name = "New course")  # Create material at this course new_material <- create_material(course_id = new_course$id,                                 title = "New material")  # Retrieve the material info materials_info <- get_materials_properties(course_id = new_course$id,                                              materials_id = new_material$id) materials_list <- get_materials_list(course_id = new_course$id)

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: can manage courseworks!
code: # Create a new coursework new_coursework <- create_coursework(course_id = new_course$id,                                     title = "New coursework",                                     due_date = lubridate::today() + lubridate::hours(24))  # Get coursework properties course_work_info <- get_coursework_properties(course_id = new_course$id, coursework_id = new_coursework$id)  # Retrieve all the courseworks for this course coursework_list <- get_coursework_list(course_id = new_course$id)

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
text: can build quiz like : can create new multiple choice question quiz just made using steps:
code: course_id <- get_course_list()$courses$id[1]  quiz_form_id <- create_quiz(   course_id = course_id,   quiz_title = "new quiz",   quiz_description = "This is a great quiz",   due_date = "2025-12-1") create_multiple_choice_question(   form_id = quiz_form_id$formId,   question = "What answer do you want?",   choice_vector = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   correct_answer = 3,   shuffle_opt = TRUE )

title: API Wrapper for Google Classroom and Google Forms
code: # Clean up this test course archive_course(new_course$id) delete_course(new_course$id)

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access Google classroom API â€” auth_from_secret
text: function authorize R package access Googleclassroom API. client.id client.secret provided, package provide predefined values.

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access Google classroom API â€” auth_from_secret
Use secrets to Authorize R package to access Google classroom API â€” auth_from_secret
text: access_token Access token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$access_token refresh_token Refresh token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$refresh_token

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access Google classroom API â€” auth_from_secret
text: OAuth token saved environment package can use users' Google data

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access Google classroom API â€” auth_from_secret
code: if (FALSE) {  token <- authorize()  auth_from_secret(   token$credentials$access_token,   token$credentials$refresh_token ) }

title: Create a new coursework â€” create_coursework
code: create_coursework(   course_id = NULL,   topic_id = NULL,   publish = FALSE,   title = NULL,   work_type = "ASSIGNMENT",   due_date = NULL,   description = NULL,   link = NULL )

title: Create a new coursework â€” create_coursework
text: course_id Course id make new coursework. Can find end URL e.g. "https://classroom.google.com/c/COURSE_ID_IS_HERE" topic_id topic ID looked . publish TRUE/FALSE, automatically publish coursework upon posting? Default posted draft (students see click Post). title Name new coursework. Required. work_type Currently supported work type ASSIGNMENT. due_date Required Due date new coursework, must given year-month-day format. description Description new coursework. string link url associated resource coursework made.

title: Create a new coursework â€” create_coursework
code: if (FALSE) { topic_id <- get_topic_list("604042323237")$topic$topicId[1] course_id <- get_course_list()$courses$id[1]  create_coursework(course_id, topic_id,   title = "a new quiz", due_date = "2025-12-1",   description = "blah blah", link = "https://www.datatrail.org/" ) }

text: course_id Course id make new materials. Can find end URL e.g. "https://classroom.google.com/c/COURSE_ID_IS_HERE" topic_id topic ID looked . publish TRUE/FALSE, automatically publish coursework upon posting? Default posted draft (students see click Post). title Name new material description description new material link URL go associated material

title: Create a new material â€” create_material
code: if (FALSE) { course_id <- get_course_list()$courses$id[3] topic_id <- get_topic_list(course_id)$topic$topicId[1]  create_material(course_id, topic_id, title = "new material") }

text: Create multiple choice question

title: Create a multiple choice question â€” create_multiple_choice_question
code: create_multiple_choice_question(   form_id = NULL,   commit_to_form = TRUE,   required = FALSE,   question = NULL,   choice_vector = NULL,   shuffle_opt = FALSE,   correct_answer = NULL,   google_forms_request = NULL,   point_value = 1,   quiet = FALSE,   location = 0 )

title: Create a multiple choice question â€” create_multiple_choice_question
text: form_id id google form updated commit_to_form Whether request committed. need build request , want say FALSE. Default TRUE required TRUE FALSE required question? Default required. question string question say choice_vector character vector choices given question shuffle_opt TRUE FALSE options shuffled? default FALSE correct_answer index corresponds correct answer `choice_vector` supplied google_forms_request google forms request object. supplied, created new. point_value integer representing many points quiet TRUE/FALSE like progress message? location new question added

title: Create a multiple choice question â€” create_multiple_choice_question
code: if (FALSE) {  create_multiple_choice_question(   form_id = "12345",   question = "What answer do you want?",   choice_vector = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   correct_answer = 3,   shuffle_opt = TRUE ) }

title: Create a quiz at a course â€” create_quiz
text: course_id course id quiz created quiz_title string indicating title quiz quiz_description description quiz made topic_id Optional - topic Id quiz posted coursework_title string coursework title work_type Currently supported work type ASSIGNMENT. due_date due date quiz, year-month-day format assignment_description description given assignment

title: Create a quiz at a course â€” create_quiz
code: if (FALSE) {  course_id <- get_course_list()$courses$id[1] topic_id <- get_topic_list(course_id)$topic$topicId[1]  create_quiz(course_id,   quiz_title = "new quiz", quiz_description = "This is a great quiz",   topic_id = topic_id, due_date = "2025-12-1" ) }

title: Create Google Form Quiz from Markua quiz â€” ottr_quiz_to_google
text: quiz_path file path markdown Markua quiz course_id id course published linked. quiz_title title quiz. supplied, attempt grabbed Markua doc topic_id topic ID quiz added . coursework_title title coursework created form_id form id quiz published. Alternatively, want new quiz made, set make_new_quiz = TRUE leave NULL. due_date due date quiz, year-month-day format make_new_quiz can used form_id specified. make new quiz copy_from_template_quiz TRUE FALSE form supplied copied used template. new_name passed `copy_form` `copy_from_template_quiz` TRUE. new file name called assignment_description description given assignment quiz_description description given quiz output_path Optional file path save question formatted data quiet TRUE/FALSE like progress message?

title: Create Google Form Quiz from Markua quiz â€” ottr_quiz_to_google
code: if (FALSE) {  # Using quiz example  quiz_path <- markdown_quiz_path()  ottr_quiz_to_google(   markdown_quiz_path(),   course_id = "606463350924",   make_new_quiz = TRUE,   due_date = "2025-12-1" ) }
